Additionally, the Compensation team provides programs that enable leaders to recognize, reward, and reinforce excellent and sustained employee performance.     Provides strategic direction for accomplishing reorganizations, which may include analysis of legal risk in partnership with General Counsel and associated job evaluation and documentation processes   Conducts benchmarking to ensure external market competitiveness   Performs job evaluations to ensure internal equity and appropriate leveling based on competency framework   Consults on salary offers for new hires, promotions, market/equity adjustments, annual merit increases, and temporary salary increases   Administers University service recognition and annual bonus programs                  The Benefits Office mission is to assist employees and their families in accessing, understanding, and maximizing the value obtained from the University's benefits programs. Nominations are welcome from November 19, 2014 to January 5, 2015 .             Team  Achievement  Award        The annual Team Achievement Award recognizes and rewards superior performance by groups of cross-functional teams in support of transformational projects across NYU which further the University’s mission and priorities. Nominations are welcome from November 19, 2014 to February 6, 2015 .             Give-A-Violet  Award        The annual Give-A-Violet Award recognizes employees who perform above and beyond the normal scope of their position and responsibilities at NYU. Nominations are welcome from January 5 to February 6, 2015 .             Service  Award        The Service Award honors employees who have reached key service milestones at NYU, beginning at 10 years and every 5-year anniversary thereafter.                                               2014-2015 Service Award honorees attend NYU's 25-year dinner.
